{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with a history of becoming unconscious and then regaining consciousness intermittently. This pattern is suggestive of a lucid interval. A lucid interval refers to a period of consciousness between episodes of unconsciousness, often seen in cases of traumatic brain injury. It is important to note that a lucid interval is commonly associated with extradural hematoma, which is a collection of blood between the skull and the outermost layer of the brain (dura mater).
